docs.abstract: US State Sec Rogers, Agr Sec Butz and Commerce Sec Dent arrive in Tokyo to attend talks with Japanese leaders on econ and monetary issues and internatl trade
docs.snippet: US State Sec Rogers, Agr Sec Butz and Commerce Sec Dent arrive in Tokyo to attend talks with Japanese leaders on econ and monetary issues and internatl trade
docs.lead_paragraph: Nadezhda Pavlova, the 17year‐old ballerina from the Soviet Union who has been getting rave notices for her appearances with the Bolshoi Ballet, is returning home before the end of the tour. A spokesman for the Hurok organization, which is sponsoring the company's performances at the Metropolitan Opera House, said that Miss Pavlova, who has appeared at every performance except two, is returning home for rest in order not be overworked.

docs.abstract: Julie Salamon reviews holiday specials on television: Cinderella on Bravo, 'Twas the Night on HBO, and Santa Baby on Fox; illus (M)
docs.snippet: Julie Salamon reviews holiday specials on television: Cinderella on Bravo, 'Twas the Night on HBO, and Santa Baby on Fox; illus (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: If Barbie can do ''The Nutcracker,'' why shouldn't Beeban Kidron reinvent ''Cinderella'' as a quirky, independent film? Shopping may be slow this Christmas, but there's an abundance of holiday specials, and anything goes.

headline.main: Cinderella's Convertible, The Prince On a Cycle
headline.print_headline: TELEVISION REVIEW; Cinderella's Convertible, The Prince On a Cycle

docs.abstract: First Deputy Mayor Donald D Kummerfeld, who turned down chance to join incoming Koch adm, announces he has agreed to become exec dir of State Emergency Financial, Control Bd (M)
docs.snippet: First Deputy Mayor Donald D Kummerfeld, who turned down chance to join incoming Koch adm, announces he has agreed to become exec dir of State Emergency Financial, Control Bd (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: First Deputy Mayor Donald D. Kummerfeld, who turned clown a chance to join the incoming New York City administration, confirmed a long‐held rumor yesterday and announced that he had agreed to become executive director of the State Emergency Financial Control Board, where he will oversee that new administration.

headline.main: Kummerfeld to Head Fiscal Panel After Carey Raises Salary $10,000
headline.print_headline: Kummerfeld to Head Fiscal Panel After Carey Raises Salary $10,000

docs.abstract: LEAD: Treasury Secretary Nicholas Brady uttered the magic words last week: ''debt reduction.'' He conceded that third world countries, heavily in debt to Western banks, needed relief. That reverses Washington's stubborn official opposition to debt forgiveness. His proposal is still too vague to be called a plan, but the outline is as welcome as it is belated.
docs.lead_paragraph: Treasury Secretary Nicholas Brady uttered the magic words last week: ''debt reduction.'' He conceded that third world countries, heavily in debt to Western banks, needed relief. That reverses Washington's stubborn official opposition to debt forgiveness. His proposal is still too vague to be called a plan, but the outline is as welcome as it is belated. The need for further definition, then action, remains urgent.

headline.main: Relief for Foreign Debtors, at Last
headline.print_headline: Relief for Foreign Debtors, at Last

docs.abstract: Vivendi’s 20 percent stake in the company could be worth $7 billion, analysts say.
docs.snippet: Vivendi’s 20 percent stake in the company could be worth $7 billion, analysts say.
docs.lead_paragraph: Executives at General Electric say they believe that Vivendi, the French conglomerate, will exercise its right later this year to sell its stake in NBC Universal, a move that could lead to NBC Universal’s being spun off into a separate public company in 2010, according to people briefed on the matter who spoke anonymously in order to discuss internal deliberations.

headline.main: Vivendi’s Stake in NBC Universal May Be Sold
headline.print_headline: Vivendi May Sell Its Stake In Universal

docs.abstract: Several prominent builders of new subdivisions in Westchester are focusing on Putnam, Dutchess and Orange Counties in New York, and Fairfield and New Haven Counties in Connecticut; builders say they are being forced out of Westchester in part by lack of buildable land left in county and high cost of what remains; photo (In the Region/Westchester) (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: DRIVEN in part by the need to compete with newer facilities, the Garden City Hotel, which traces its roots to the late 1800's, has nearly completed the first phase of a $25 million interior renovation intended to reflect its elegant history as a grand hotel.

docs.abstract: The billionaire mathematician James H. Simons has led a life of ferocious curiosity.
docs.snippet: The billionaire mathematician James H. Simons has led a life of ferocious curiosity.
docs.lead_paragraph: James H. Simons likes to play against type. He is a billionaire star of mathematics and private investment who often wins praise for his financial gifts to scientific research and programs to get children hooked on math.

docs.abstract: Roberta Beverley Fleming, daughter of Charles L. Fleming of New York and Little Silver, N. J., and the late Estelle Livingston Fleming, was married here yesterday afternoon to John Wallace Ried, son of Mr. and Mrs. Fred Edward Ried of Fishcreek, Wis.
docs.lead_paragraph: Roberta Beverley Fleming, daughter of Charles L. Fleming of New York and Little Silver, N. J., and the late Estelle Livingston Fleming, was married here yesterday afternoon to John Wallace Ried, son of Mr. and Mrs. Fred Edward Ried of Fishcreek, Wis.of the Lutheran School of Theology in Chicago, received a doctorate in psychology from Boston University,

docs.abstract: Here is a selective listing by critics of The Times of new or noteworthy movies and film series playing this weekend in New York City. * denotes a highly recommended film or series. Ratings and running times are in parentheses. An index of reviews of films opening today appears on page 7.    Now Playing     ''AMISTAD,'' starring Djimon Hounsou, Anthony Hopkins and Matthew McConaughey. Directed by Steven Spielberg (R, 150 minutes). Irrefutably worthy in its attention to a long-overlooked chapter in American history, this story of a slave mutiny and subsequent trial is still a film whose zestiest character is John Quincy Adams (played by Mr. Hopkins). It has great earnestness, impeccable credentials and Mr. Spielberg's great storytelling power. What it lacks is an Oskar Schindler, a flawed, three-dimensional character through whom the atrocity of slavery can be understood. The best moments in this long, instructive tale are those that simply bring the slaves' pride, fear and outrage to life. Mr. McConaughey, the weak link in casting that includes Nigel Hawthorne as Martin Van Buren, should cease and desist from playing any more smart lawyers (Janet Maslin).
docs.lead_paragraph: Here is a selective listing by critics of The Times of new or noteworthy movies and film series playing this weekend in New York City. * denotes a highly recommended film or series.
